node.title: Billie Eilish says porn 'destroyed my brain' at age 11, so how can parents prevent this?
node.alt: A close-up shows Billie Eilish holding up her long black nails next to her face.
node.description: Parents are being urged to have early conversations with their children about pornography, but it could soon become tougher to access it in Australia.
node.content:
["Parents are being urged to have early conversations with their children about pornography, after US artist Billie Eilish spoke out about watching it\u00a0at the age of 11.\u00a0", "The 19-year-old star\u00a0addressed the topic of pornography\u00a0during an interview with The Howard Stern show this week and called\u00a0it a disgrace,\u00a0revealing\u00a0the harmful impact it had on her life.\u00a0", "\"I think it really destroyed my brain and I feel incredibly devastated that I was exposed to so much porn,\" she said.\u00a0", "She said her exposure had a negative influence on her early sexual experiences.", "\"The first few times I had sex, I was not saying no to things that were not good,\" she explained.", "\"It was because I thought that\u2019s what I was supposed to be attracted to.\"", "
Soon it could\u00a0be more difficult for children to access porn
", "The eSafety Commissioner, Julie Inman Grant, said pornography was easily accessible for children, but next year the new Online Safety Act would curb access for minors.\u00a0", "\"[There]\u00a0will be some mandatory internet codes that will require technology providers to restrict children's access to online pornography,\" she told the ABC's PM program.", "\"We've also got a restricted-access system provision that has been around a long time, but it's been updated for those in the adult industry who are creating pornography to make sure that children are protected from accessing that content.\"", "", "
eSafety Commisioner Julie Inman Grant says there are many ways children can access pornography online but there are also many prevention measures.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "However, she\u00a0warned that, whether by accident or on purpose, the pornographic content children were seeing was becoming more extreme, violent and misogynistic.\u00a0", "She said it was important that parents had early conversations with their children \"about sex education and intimacy, and not letting them use online pornography as a de facto sexual education tool\".\u00a0", "The eSafety website provides advice on how to talk to kids aged under eight, eight to 12, and as teenagers.\u00a0", "\"We can reassure them that they won't be in trouble;\u00a0we can stay calm and listen, assess and pause, and then sort of help to explain what it is they've seen.\"", "She also suggested parental controls on electronic devices and using platforms like Youtube Kids.\u00a0", "
Exposure affecting children's behaviour
", "The Youth Wellbeing Project is one service trying to\u00a0help young people navigate the issue and it runs programs at schools in Brisbane\u00a0that\u00a0discuss healthy relationships and the impact of pornography.", "Managing director Liz Walker said issues with\u00a0sexting, sexual harassment or inappropriate behaviour towards females in the playground often stem\u00a0from what young people access\u00a0online.\u00a0", "Pornography can also trigger addiction, impact mental health, shape attitudes and behaviours, and affect relationships.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"We have to address the impact of pornography without skirting around it,\" said\u00a0Ms Walker.", "\"What we're really trying to teach young people is to think critically about the media that they're consuming.", "\"In younger years, we might be thinking about body safety, thinking about the healthy things that we can put into our brain and, therefore, the unhealthy things \u2026\u00a0and then the older they get we might be talking about the impact of pornography itself on attitudes and relationships.\"\u00a0"]
